meanings.definition: To wear out or exhaust through use or excessive activity.
meanings.sent1: Running every day quickly outwears my shoes.
meanings.sent2: My favorite shirt outwears quickly because I wear it so often.
meanings.sent3: Exercising too much outwears my energy, and I end up needing a nap.
meanings.sent4: Studying for hours on end outwears my concentration like a marathon runner.
meanings.sent5: The constant friction from rubbing against the rough surface outwears the fabric over time.

meanings.definition: To last longer than something else.
meanings.sent1: My old car outwears all the new models on the road.
meanings.sent2: Quality craftsmanship ensures that the antique clock outwears modern ones.
meanings.sent3: The ancient tree outwears all the young saplings around it, standing tall and proud.
meanings.sent4: Her patience outwears everyone else's, making her the best teacher in the school.
meanings.sent5: The durable material of the backpack outwears all others, proving its superior quality.
